wikipedia_page.main: Sir Patrick Michael Ernest David McNair-Wilson (born 28 May 1929) is a former British Conservative Member of Parliament and consultant.

response: His brother Patrick McNair-Wilson, who had been Conservative MP for Lewisham West from 1964 to 1966, was also a by-election winner, returning to Parliament in 1968 for the New Forest constituency.

List of female members of the House of Commons of the United Kingdom
response: |Daughter of Michael McNair-Wilson. Niece of Patrick McNair-Wilson.

Farris was born and grew up in Bucklebury, West Berkshire, England. Both her father Michael McNair-Wilson and uncle Patrick McNair-Wilson were Conservative MPs. She studied philosophy, politics and economics at Lady Margaret Hall, Oxford, graduating in 2000 with an upper second class degree. Farris worked as a journalist for BBC and Reuters and also worked for Hillary Clinton when she was a United States Senator for New York.
* Patrick McNair-Wilson (born 1929), British Member of Parliament for Lewisham West (1964–1966) and New Forest (1968–1997)
